official-title.#text: To establish a demonstration program for competency-based education.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives July 23, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Advancing Competency-Based Education Demonstration Project Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Advancing Competency-Based Education Demonstration Project Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

an amendment to the eligible entity’s application under

text.#text: an eligible entity whose demonstration project has been evaluated under
the proposed maximum enrollment or annual enrollment growth for the project;
how the eligible entity will successfully carry out the project with such maximum enrollment or enrollment growth; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that are related to such maximum enrollment or enrollment growth; and

text.#text: any other amendments to the eligible entity’s application under

text.#text: the
Notwithstanding the assurance required with respect to maximum enrollment under
Each application shall include—
a description of the competency-based education to be offered by the eligible entity under the demonstration project;

a description of the proposed academic delivery, business, and financial models for the demonstration project, including explanations of how competency-based education offered under the demonstration project would—
result in the achievement of competencies;
differ from standard credit hour approaches, in whole or in part; and
result in lower costs or shortened time to degree, certificate, or credential completion;
a description of how the competency-based education offered under the demonstration project will progress a student toward completion of a degree, certificate, or credential;

a description of how the eligible entity will articulate the transcript from the competency-based education demonstration project to another program within an institution of higher education that is part of the eligible entity or to another institution of higher education;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for which the eligible entity is seeking a waiver, and why such waiver is necessary to carry out the demonstration project;

text.#text: a description of the statutory and regulatory requirements described in

a description of how the eligible entity will develop and evaluate the competencies and assessments of student knowledge (which may include prior-learning assessments) administered as part of the demonstration project, including how such competencies and assessments are aligned with workforce needs;

a description of the proposal for determining a student’s Federal student aid eligibility under this title for participating in the demonstration project, the award and distribution of such aid, and safeguards to ensure that students are making satisfactory progress that warrants disbursement of such aid;
a description of the students to whom competency-based education will be offered, including an assurance that the demonstration project will enroll a minimum of 50 and a maximum of 3,000 students;

an assurance that students participating in the demonstration project will not be eligible for more Federal assistance under this title than such students would have been eligible for under a traditional program;

an assurance the eligible entity will identify and disseminate best practices with respect to the demonstration project to other eligible entities carrying out a demonstration project under this section; and

A description of the population of students served by the eligible entity that are veterans or members of the Armed Forces and how such eligible entity will, when appropriate, incorporate the specific needs of such population when carrying out the demonstration project.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select not more than 30 eligible entities to carry out a competency-based education demonstration project under this section.

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall—

text.#text: In selecting eligible entities under
prioritize projects which show promise in reducing the time or cost required to complete a degree, certificate, or credential;
consider the number and quality of applications received;
consider an eligible entity’s—
ability to successfully execute the demonstration project as described in the eligible entity’s application under
commitment and ability to effectively finance the demonstration project;
ability to provide administrative capability and the expertise to evaluate student progress based on measures other than credit hours or clock hours; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to evaluate the demonstration project and the impact of the demonstration project;

text.#text: commitment to work with the
ensure the selection of a diverse group of eligible entities with respect to size, mission, and geographic distribution of the eligible entities;
not limit the types of programs of study or courses of study approved for participation in a demonstration project; and
not select an eligible entity that has had, for 1 of the preceding 2 fiscal years—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) that is 30 percent or greater; and

text.#text: a cohort default rate (defined in
a borrowing rate of loans under this title of more than 50 percent of the students enrolled at institutions of higher education of the eligible entity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall make available to the authorizing committees and the public a list of eligible entities selected to carry out a demonstration project under this section, which shall include for each such eligible entity—

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text: the specific statutory and regulatory requirements being waived under
a description of the competency-based education programs of study or courses of study to be offered under the project.
The average number of credit hours the students earned prior to enrollment in the demonstration project, if applicable.

The number and percentage of students participating in the demonstration project that are also enrolled in programs of study or courses of study offered in credit hours or clock hours, disaggregated by student status as a first-year, second-year, third-year, fourth-year, or other student.
The average period of time between the enrollment of a student in the demonstration project and the first assessment of student knowledge of such student.
The average time to 25 percent, 50 percent, 75 percent, and 100 percent of the completion of a degree, certificate, or credential by a student who participated in the demonstration project.
The percentage of assessments of student knowledge that students passed on the first attempt, during the period of the participation in the demonstration project by the students.

The percentage of assessments of student knowledge that students passed on the second attempt and the average period of time between the first and second attempts by students, during the period of the participation in the demonstration project by the students.
The average number of competencies a student acquired while participating in the demonstration project and the period of time during which the student acquired such competencies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may reasonably require.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Institute of Education Sciences

text.#text: Each eligible entity that carries out a demonstration project under this section shall provide to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to the students participating in the competency-based education project carried out by the eligible entity the number and percentage of students completing a competency-based education program or course of study offered by such eligible entity who find employment in a field related to the program or course of study of such students.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Institute of Education Sciences

text.#text: Each eligible entity that carries out a demonstration project under this section may provide to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, at the request of an eligible entity, provide technical assistance to such eligible entity to assist such eligible entity in collecting and reporting accurate information relating to the employment of students participating in a competency-based education project carried out by such eligible entity.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Institute of Education Sciences

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: disaggregated by age, race, gender, disability status, and status as a recipient of a Federal Pell Grant, provided that the disaggregation of the information does not identify any individual student participating in the demonstration project.

text.#text: Each eligible entity shall provide the information required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall annually evaluate each demonstration project under this section. Each evaluation shall include—

text.#text: The
the extent to which the eligible entity has met the goals set forth in its application to the

the number and types of students participating in the competency-based education offered under the project, including the progress of participating students toward completion of a degree, certificate, or credential, and the extent to which participation and retention in such project increased;
whether the project led to reduced cost or time to completion of a degree, certificate, or credential, and the amount of cost or time reduced for such completion;
obstacles related to student financial assistance for competency-based education;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: present difficulties for students or institutions of higher education;

text.#text: the extent to which statutory or regulatory requirements not waived under
degree, certificate, or credential completion rates;
retention rates;
total cost and net cost to the student of the competency-based education offered under the project;
a description of the assessments of student knowledge and the corresponding competencies; and
outcomes of the assessments of student knowledge.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall annually provide to the authorizing committees a report on—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Institute of Education Sciences

text.#text: The
the evaluations of the demonstration projects required under
the number and types of students receiving assistance under this title for competency-based education under such projects;
the retention and completion rates of students participating in such projects;

any proposed statutory or regulatory changes designed to support and enhance the expansion of competency-based education, which may be independent of or combined with traditional credit hour or clock hour projects;
the most effective means of delivering competency-based education through demonstration projects; and
the appropriate level and distribution methodology of Federal assistance under this title for students enrolled in competency-based education.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, on a continuing basis—

text.#text: In carrying out this section, the
assure compliance of eligible entities with the requirements of this title (other than the provisions of law and regulations that are waived under
provide technical assistance;
monitor fluctuations in the student population enrolled in the eligible entities carrying out the demonstration projects under this section;
consult with appropriate accrediting agencies or associations and appropriate State regulatory authorities for additional ways of improving the delivery of competency-based education; and
collect and disseminate to eligible entities carrying out a demonstration project under this section, best practices with respect to demonstration projects under this section.

An eligible entity carrying out a demonstration project under this section shall ensure that each institution of higher education of the eligible entity provides to each student, or the parents of each minor student, enrolled in the institution of higher education—

header.#text: Disclosure of authorization to sell student data

text.#text: a disclosure letter, which describes the personally identifiable information of the student that may be sold by a person with whom the institution of higher education has an agreement to provide software applications for students; and
an option to opt-out of such personally identifiable information from being sold.
For the purpose of this section:

quote.#tail: means an educational process or program that measures knowledge, skills, and experience through assessments of such knowledge, skills, or experience in place of or in addition to the use of credit hours or clock hours.

text.#text: The term
The term

an institution of higher education including an institution of higher education that offers a dual-enrollment program under which a secondary school student is able simultaneously to earn credit toward a secondary school diploma and a postsecondary degree, certificate, or credential;
a system of institutions of higher education; or
a consortium of institutions of higher education.
